meanings.definition: A font weight that is heavier than regular but lighter than bold.
meanings.sent1: I chose the semibold font for the heading of my project.
meanings.sent2: The designer recommended using a semibold typeface for the logo.
meanings.sent3: The semibold text on the menu made the dish names easier to read.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a semibold quality that commanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The semibold letters on the sign stood out against the white background.

meanings.definition: A typeface with a moderate thickness.
meanings.sent1: The article was written in a clear semibold font.
meanings.sent2: The book cover featured the title in a stylish semibold typeface.
meanings.sent3: The semibold letters on the poster caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting resembled a semibold style, making it easy to read.
meanings.sent5: The semibold print on the packaging made the product look professional.

meanings.definition: A style of text that is slightly thicker than normal.
meanings.sent1: The semibold text in the brochure was easy to read from a distance.
meanings.sent2: The website used a semibold font for the headings to make them stand out.
meanings.sent3: The semibold letters on the banner added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent4: Her signature had a semibold flair that made it unique.
meanings.sent5: The semibold font on the invitation gave it a modern look.
